p: The American Psychological Association (APA) Mental Health and Our Changing Climate guidance document highlights the imperative role for frequent and clear communication to support psychosocial wellbeing in a changing climate [ 8]. The United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNISDR) suggests that clear, early-warning communication efforts can save lives during extreme weather events [ 61]. Furthermore, communication can increase community resilience by supporting people to assess risks and respond before an extreme weather event occurs [ 46].
